rules: Rule1: If the research station is located in the rainforest, then the research team studies medicinal plants.
Rule2: If the conservation law protects the rainforest, then the rare orchid does not become extinct.
Rule3: If native trees are replanted, then the ecosystem is restored.
Rule4: If ecologists monitor wildlife, then native trees are replanted.
Rule5: Either illegal loggers log the rainforest, or the rainforest is conserved.
Rule6: If rangers patrol the rainforest, then illegal loggers do not log the rainforest.
Rule7: Either rangers patrol the rainforest, or the community reports illegal logging.
Rule8: If the conservation group alerts the authorities, then, should the community report illegal logging, illegal loggers do not log the rainforest.
Rule9: Either the conservation group alerts the authorities, or the police investigate the logging complaint.
Rule10: If the police investigate the logging complaint, then, provided that the community reports illegal logging, illegal loggers do not log the rainforest.
Rule11: If the research team documents biodiversity, then policy-makers cite the journal article.
Rule12: Either the environmental group petitions the government, or the conservation group lobbies parliament.
Rule13: If the conservation group lobbies parliament, then, under the condition that the community reports illegal logging, illegal loggers do not log the rainforest.

Rule14: If the public supports the environmental group, then, should the environmental group petition the government, it follows that, if the community reports illegal logging, illegal loggers do not log the rainforest.
Rule15: Either the public supports the environmental group, or a scientist endorses the petition.

Rule16: If a scientist endorses the petition, then, given that the environmental group petitions the government, then, if the community reports illegal logging, illegal loggers do not log the rainforest.
Rule17: If the lab technician tests soil samples, then the water supply is not contaminated with chemicals.
Rule18: If the research team identifies a rare orchid, then the lab technician analyzes the rare orchid.
Rule19: If the lab technician analyzing the rare orchid does not lead to the rainforest being conserved, then the rare orchid becomes extinct.

Rule20: If neither the research team publishes a journal article nor the scenario where failure of the research team studying medicinal plants to conserve the rainforest leading to storm damage does not result in engineers repairing the research station, then the research team delays fieldwork.

Rule21: If neither the research team publishes a journal article nor the scenario where failure of the research team studying medicinal plants to conserve the rainforest leading to storm damage does not result in engineers repairing the research station, then the research team does not delay fieldwork.

Rule22: If failure of the research team studying medicinal plants to conserve the rainforest does not lead to the research station being damaged by a storm, then engineers do not repair the research station.

Rule23: If it is not the case that failure of the research team studying medicinal plants to conserve the rainforest leading to storm damage results in engineers repairing the research station, then the research team documents biodiversity.

Rule24: If failure of the rainforest not being conserved leading to the water supply not being polluted not resulting in ecologists monitoring wildlife does not lead to the government not funding the conservation program, then the conservation program is expanded.

Rule25: If failure of the rainforest not being conserved leading to the water supply not being polluted not resulting in ecologists monitoring wildlife does not lead to the government not funding the conservation program, then the conservation program is not expanded.

Rule26: If failure of the rainforest not being conserved to lead to the water supply not being polluted does not result in ecologists monitoring wildlife, then the government funds the conservation program.
Rule27: If the rainforest is not conserved, then the water supply is polluted.
Rule28: If the rainforest is not conserved, then the water supply is contaminated with chemicals.
facts: Fact1: The research station is located in the rainforest.
Fact2: The conservation law protects the rainforest.
Fact3: The lab technician tests soil samples.
Fact4: The research team identifies a rare orchid.
Fact5: The ecosystem is not restored.
Fact6: Policy-makers do not cite the journal article.
Fact7: The research station is not damaged by a storm.
Fact8: The research team does not publish a journal article.
